name: src/Draggable/DragEvent/index.js
src/Draggable/Draggable.js
Draggable
description: This is the core draggable library that does the heavy lifting

name: destroy
description:
Destroys Draggable instance. This removes all internal event listeners and
deactivates sensors and plugins

name: addPlugin
description: Adds plugin to this draggable instance. This will end up calling the attach method of the plugin

params.name: plugins
params.description: Plugins that you want attached to draggable

name: removePlugin
description:
Removes plugins that are already attached to this draggable instance. This will end up calling
the detach method of the plugin

params.name: plugins
params.description: Plugins that you want detached from draggable

name: addSensor
description: Adds sensors to this draggable instance. This will end up calling the attach method of the sensor

params.name: sensors
params.description: Sensors that you want attached to draggable

name: removeSensor
description:
Removes sensors that are already attached to this draggable instance. This will end up calling
the detach method of the sensor

params.name: sensors
params.description: Sensors that you want attached to draggable

name: addContainer
description: Adds container to this draggable instance

params.name: containers
params.description: Containers you want to add to draggable

name: removeContainer
description: Removes container from this draggable instance

params.name: containers
params.description: Containers you want to remove from draggable

name: getClassNameFor
description: Returns class name for class identifier

name: isDragging
description: Returns true if this draggable instance is currently dragging

name: getDraggableElementsForContainer
description:
Returns draggable elements for a given container, excluding the mirror and
original source element if present

name: [getAppendableContainer]
description: Returns appendable container for mirror based on the appendTo option

AutoScroll
description: AutoScroll plugin which scrolls the closest scrollable parent

name: findScrollableElementFrame

name: [onDragStart]
description: Drag start handler. Finds closest scrollable parent in separate frame

name: [onDragMove]
description: Drag move handler. Remembers mouse position and initiates scrolling

name: [onDragStop]
description: Drag stop handler. Cancels scroll animations and resets state

name: [scroll]
description: Scroll function that does the heavylifting

DragSensor
description: This sensor picks up native browser drag events and dictates drag operations

name: mouseDownTimeout
description: Mouse down timer which will end up setting the draggable attribute, unless canceled

name: draggableElement
description: Draggable element needs to be remembered to unset the draggable attribute after drag operation has completed

name: nativeDraggableElement
description: Native draggable element could be links or images, their draggable state will be disabled during drag operation

name: attach
description: Attaches sensors event listeners to the DOM

name: detach
description: Detaches sensors event listeners to the DOM

Droppable
description:
Droppable is built on top of Draggable and allows dropping draggable elements
into droppable element

name: droppables
description: All droppable elements on drag start

name: lastDroppable
description: Last droppable element that the source was dropped into

name: initialDroppable
description: Initial droppable element that the source was drag from

name: getClassNameFor
description: Returns class name for class identifier

name: [drop]
description: Drop method drops a draggable element into a droppable element

params.name: droppable
params.description: Droppable element to drop draggable into

name: [release]
description: Release method moves the previously dropped element back into its original position

name: [closestDroppable]
description: Returns closest droppable element for even target

name: [getDroppables]
description: Returns all current droppable elements for this draggable instance

dragEvent

src/Sortable/Sortable.js
Sortable
description:
Sortable is built on top of Draggable and allows sorting of draggable elements. Sortable will keep
track of the original index and emits the new index as you drag over draggable elements.

name: startIndex
description: start index of source on drag start

name: index
description: Returns true index of element within its container during drag operation, i.e. excluding mirror and original source

name: src/Sortable/SortableEvent/SortableEvent.js
dragEvent
description: Original drag event that triggered this sortable event

name: startIndex
description: Start index of source on sortable start

name: over
description: Draggable element you are hovering over

name: overContainer
description: Draggable container element you are hovering over

name: newIndex
description: New index of this sorted event

name: src/Sortable/SortableEvent/index.js
src/Sortable/index.js
content:

export default Sortable;

name: src/Swappable/Swappable.js
Swappable
description:
Swappable is built on top of Draggable and allows swapping of draggable elements.
Order is irrelevant to Swappable.

description: Last draggable element that was dragged over

name: src/Swappable/SwappableEvent/SwappableEvent.js
dragEvent
description: Original drag event that triggered this swappable event

name: swappedElement
description: The draggable element that you swapped with

AbstractEvent
description:
All events fired by draggable inherit this class. You can call `cancel()` to
cancel a specific event or you can check if an event has been canceled by
calling `canceled()`.

name: canceled
description: Check if event has been canceled

name: src/shared/utils/index.js

content: > **Ready for production!** While Draggable may still be in beta, all existing features are stable and safe for consumption. Draggable will exit beta once all remaining features have been implemented. Get complete control over drag and drop behaviour with Draggable! Draggable abstracts native browser events into a comprehensive API to create a custom drag and drop experience. `Draggable` comes with additional modules: `Sortable`, `Droppable`, `Swappable`. Draggable itself does not perform any sorting behaviour while dragging, but does the heavy lifting, e.g. creates mirror, emits events, manages sensor events, makes elements draggable. The additional modules are built on top of `Draggable` and therefore provide a similar API interface, for more information read the documentation below. **Features** - Works with native drag, mouse, touch and force touch events - Can extend dragging behaviour by hooking into draggables event life cycle - Can extend drag detection by adding sensors to draggable - The library is targeted ES6 first ## Table of Contents * [Install](#install) * [Documentation](#documentation) * [Contributing](#contributing) * [Roadmap](#roadmap) * [Copyright](#copyright) ## Install You can install the library via npm. ``` npm install @shopify/draggable --save ``` or via yarn: ``` yarn add @shopify/draggable ``` or via CDN ```html ``` ## Documentation You can find the documentation for each module within their respective directories. - [Draggable](src/Draggable) - [DragEvent](src/Draggable/DragEvent) - [DraggableEvent](src/Draggable/DraggableEvent) - [MirrorEvent](src/Draggable/MirrorEvent) - [Plugins](src/Draggable/Plugins) - [Accessibility](src/Draggable/Plugins/Accessibility) - [Mirror](src/Draggable/Plugins/Mirror) - [Sensors](src/Draggable/Sensors) - [DragSensor](src/Draggable/Sensors/DragSensor) - [ForceTouchSensor](src/Draggable/Sensors/ForceTouchSensor) - [MouseSensor](src/Draggable/Sensors/MouseSensor) - [Sensor](src/Draggable/Sensors/Sensor) - [SensorEvent](src/Draggable/Sensors/SensorEvent) - [TouchSensor](src/Draggable/Sensors/TouchSensor) - [Droppable](src/Droppable) - [DroppableEvent](src/Droppable/DroppableEvent) - [Plugins](src/Plugins) - [Collidable](src/Plugins/Collidable) - [Snappable](src/Plugins/Snappable) - [SwapAnimation](src/Plugins/SwapAnimation) - [Sortable](src/Sortable) - [SortableEvent](src/Sortable/SortableEvent) - [Swappable](src/Swappable) - [SwappableEvent](src/Swappable/SwappableEvent) ## Running examples To run the examples locally run ``` $ yarn install $ yarn build $ yarn start ``` This will start a server that hosts the contents of `examples/`. It also watches for file changes from both `src/` and `examples/src` and reloads the browser. ## Contributing Contributions are more than welcome, the code base is still new and needs more love. For more information, please checkout the [contributing document](https://github.com/Shopify/draggable/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md). ## Roadmap We are currently working on `v1.0.0-beta.5`. Check out the [project board](https://github.com/Shopify/draggable/projects/3) to see tasks and follow progress on the release. Any Pull Requests should be pointed against the feature branch `v1.0.0-beta.5`. ## Copyright Copyright (c) 2018 Shopify. See LICENSE.md for further details.
